ruleset.name: ARCHIBUS.pmd.ruleset
ruleset.description: ARCHIBUS PMD Plugin preferences rule set

rule.message: Avoid variables with short names like {0}
rule.name: ShortVariable
rule.description: Detects when a field, local, or parameter has a very short name. Exception: "id".

rule.message: Do not use hungarian notation when naming variables such as {0}
rule.name: DoNotUseHungarianNotationString
rule.description: Detects names of variable of type String starting with "str" or "string".

rule.message: Do not use hungarian notation when naming variables such as {0}
rule.name: DoNotUseHungarianNotationInt
rule.description: Detects names of variable of type int or Integer starting with "i" or "n" or "int".

property.name: xpath

rule.message: Do not use hungarian notation when naming variables such as {0}
rule.name: DoNotUseHungarianNotationFloat
rule.description: Detects names of variable of type float or Float starting with "f" or "float".

rule.message: Do not use hungarian notation when naming variables such as {0}
rule.name: DoNotUseHungarianNotationDouble
rule.description: Detects names of variable of type double or Double starting with "d" or "double".

rule.name: AvoidStaticFields
rule.message: Static fields that are not literal constants should be avoided.
rule.description: Detects static fields that are not literal constants. Static fields are usually used to implement singleton pattern or caching, which is not a good practice. There are better ways to implement singleton pattern and caching.

rule.message: Avoid using SQL in Java code.
rule.name: AvoidUsingSql
rule.description: Using SQL statements should be an exception. Use DataSource parameters instead. Using SQL restrictions should be an exception. Use parsed restrictions instead.

property.name: xpath
property.value: //Literal [contains(@Image, "SELECT ") or contains(@Image, "INSERT ") or contains(@Image, "UPDATE ") or contains(@Image, "DELETE ") or contains(@Image, "WHERE ") or contains(@Image, "COMMIT") or contains(@Image, "ROLLBACK")]

rule.example: public class BadClass { final static String SQL_1 = " SELECT "; // bad, contains SQL key word final static String SQL_2 = " INSERT "; // bad, contains SQL key word final static String SQL_3 = " UPDATE "; // bad, contains SQL key word final static String SQL_4 = " DELETE "; // bad, contains SQL key word final static String SQL_5 = " WHERE "; // bad, contains SQL key word final static String SQL_6 = " COMMIT "; // bad, contains SQL key word final static String SQL_7 = " ROLLBACK "; // bad, contains SQL key word }

rule.message: Use explicit scoping instead of the default package private level
rule.name: DefaultPackage
rule.description: Use explicit scoping instead of the default package private level.
